final_note: He is both savior and monster, and he no longer pretends otherwise. This chapter hardens him into a sovereign actor: trust systems replace leashes, transparency replaces propaganda, and ultimatums replace begging. Yet he also softens in the places that matter—asking for anchors, choosing intimacy as medicine, and treating his family as the only authority worth obeying.
